topArticle.title: Deadly US winter storm leaves flights delayed and thousands without power
topArticle.snippet: At least a dozen people have died in multiple US states possibly due to the storm, officials have said.

topArticle.title: Israel says it has retrieved remains of final Gaza hostage
topArticle.snippet: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu called Ran Gvili’s return "an extraordinary achievement".

topArticle.title: Australia cancels visa of Israeli influencer accused of ‘spreading hatred’
topArticle.snippet: Social media influencer Sammy Yahood is known to spread Islamophobic content online.
topArticle.titleJa: オーストラリア、イスラエルのインフルエンサーのビザを取り消し、「ヘイトを拡散」したとして非難

topArticle.title: France's lawmakers vote to ban social media for under-15s
topArticle.snippet: As social media usage has grown, it has heightened concerns about excessive screen time and its negative impact on child development and mental health.
topArticle.titleJa: フランスの議員、15歳未満のソーシャルメディア禁止を可決

topArticle.title: ‘It’s the sovereignty of the country’: Guinea-Bissau says US vaccine study suspended
topArticle.snippet:
Despite US pushback, officials in west Africa say controversial hepatitis B study on pause amid ethics concerns
US health officials insisted it was still on. African health leaders said it was cancelled. At the heart of the controversy is the west African nation of Guinea-Bissau – one of the poorest countries in the world and the proposed site of a hotly debated US-funded study on vaccines.
The study on hepatitis B vaccination, to be led by Danish researchers, became a flashpoint after major changes to the US vaccination schedule and prompted questions about how research is conducted ethically in other countries.
 Continue reading...
topArticle.titleJa: 「国の主権」：ギニアビサウ、米国のワクチン研究を一時停止と発表

topArticle.title: Neom no more? Saudi Arabia reduces ambitious plans for 'The Line' and futuristic megacity
topArticle.snippet: After years of cost overruns and delays, Saudi Arabia’s flagship futuristic megaproject, Neom, is set to be significantly scaled back. The futuristic super-city, meant to run entirely on alternative energy sources, was due to host the 2029 Asian Winter Games, which has now been postponed.
topArticle.titleJa: ネオムはもう終わり？サウジアラビアが「ザ・ライン」と未来都市の野心的な計画を縮小

topArticle.title: Uzbekistan hosts major international sports meetings, strengthens regional role
topArticle.snippet: More than 360 senior sports officials visited Tashkent as Asia’s Olympic leadership changed hands, new cooperation agreements were signed, and international federations inspected cutting-edge facilities, signalling rising confidence in Uzbekistan’s sporting infrastructure and organisation.
topArticle.titleJa: ウズベキスタンが主要な国際スポーツ会議を主催し、地域的役割を強化

topArticle.title: Hungary's PM Viktor Orbán accuses Ukraine of election interference and summons ambassador
topArticle.snippet: As Hungary’s elections approach, Orbán has escalated an anti-Ukraine campaign and accused his rival, Péter Magyar, of entering into a pact with Kyiv to overthrow his government and install a pro-Western administration.
topArticle.titleJa: ハンガリーのオルバン首相、ウクライナが選挙に干渉したと非難し、大使を召喚
